meanings.definition: One who discards or gets rid of something.
meanings.sent1: The discarder threw the broken toy in the trash.
meanings.sent2: My mom is the discarder in our house, always cleaning out old things.
meanings.sent3: The discarder at the thrift store found a hidden gem among the donations.
meanings.sent4: As a discarder of negativity, she only kept positive thoughts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The discarder's job is to remove unwanted items efficiently.

meanings.definition: To throw away or reject something as useless or unwanted.
meanings.sent1: Please discarder the old newspapers into the recycling bin.
meanings.sent2: I will discarder these old clothes that no longer fit me.
meanings.sent3: He decided to discarder his original plan and come up with a new one.
meanings.sent4: She had to discarder her fears in order to take the leap of faith.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to discarder the spoiled ingredients to make a fresh dish.
